title: Kyrgios bound for Perth
text:
Hopman Cup 2015: Nick Kyrgios set to represent Australia at Perth tournament Chris Robinson PerthNow Hopman Cup 2015: Nick Kyrgios set to represent Australia at Perth tournament Chris Robinson PerthNow Nick Kyrgios is heading to the Hopman Cup. Picture: AFP 
CONTROVERSIAL tennis star Nick Kyrgios is set to bring his talents to this summer’s Hopman Cup. 
The 20-year-old is set to be confirmed to lead the Australian Green team when the final field is confirmed at the tournament launch at Crown Sports Bar on Wednesday morning. 
It comes after popular veteran Lleyton Hewitt and local favourite Casey Dellacqua were announced to team up for the Australia Gold unit for the mixed teams tournament. 
World No.2 Andy Murray will be one of the Hopman Cup’s biggest drawcards, partnering Heather Watson for the second straight year. 
The remainder of the team line-ups, including the US combination, will be revealed at Wednesday’s launch. 
Kyrgios has rarely been far from controversy over the past 12 months, with his antics often overshadowing his World No.30 ranking. Other Stories
